article.headline: Oakland, Mich. 79, W. Illinois 52
article.story: MACOMB, Ill. (AP) -- Vova Severovas scored 24 points Saturday to lead Oakland to a 79-52 win over Western Illinois. The Golden Grizzlies jumped out to a 21-5 lead in the opening nine minutes and never trailed. Oakland led 44-20 at halftime and did not allow Western Illinois to cut the lead to less than 13 points over the final 20 minutes. Oakland (10-9, 3-0 Mid-Continent) shot 56.3 percent for the game, including 11-for-19 from 3-point range. Western Illinois shot 40.7 percent, and 5-for-18 from beyond the arc. Erik Kangas joined Severovas in double figures with 14 points. Severovas led the Golden Grizzlies with eight rebounds. Sammy Hunter and Lorenzo Taylor scored 10 points apiece to lead Western Illinois (4-14, 0-4), with Taylor adding a game-high 11 rebounds.

statistics.name: assists
statistics.description: The number of times a player who passes the ball to a teammate in a way that leads to a score by field goal, meaning that he or she was "assisting" in the basket. There is some judgment involved in deciding whether a passer should be credited with an assist.

statistics.description: The number of times a player loses possession to the other team.
